title: Ketanji Brown Jackson Hearings Shine Spotlight on Child Pornography Law
sub_head: Judges, faced with offenses, grapple with sentencing guidelines crafted by Congress long ago
body:
Supreme Court nominee Ketanji Brown Jackson’s record in sentencing child-pornography offenders became a focus of her confirmation hearings this week after a handful of Republican senators claimed she had been too lenient. Her supporters, meanwhile, said her record was consistent with how other federal judges, both Democratic and Republican appointees, handle such cases. Here’s a look at the state of the law and Judge Jackson’s cases.
Under federal law, there are two main categories of child pornography cases. One involves offenders who produce child pornography and the other includes people who possess, receive or distribute it.
